text: (upbeat music)
- Hi everyone, I'm Michael Connor,
and I lead the generative AI practice

at Amazon Web Services for our
consumer packaged goods group
and also our retail group.

The last five months
have been a wild ride,

it's been generative AI,
all day, all the time.

It is top of mind for
everyone trying to think about
how this is gonna affect their business,

and a lot of people see the
power of this technology,
they see it being disruptive,

they wanna make sure
they have a handle on it.

And as leaders, they're
trying to think through
how their organizations get focused

and how they use it to innovate
and how they move quickly.
Here's why we think this is interesting.
We have quickly seen people go from

looking at how to
understand the technology,
trying to figure out what it is,

into proof of concept, working
with the business to align,

and then even a lot of customers
moving into production.
We see so many use cases.

Executives are trying to
understand how they scale this,
not just one or two use cases,

but hundreds of use cases
across their business.
We talked to a lot of these leaders
about how they get started.

We try to tell them to
instill a sense of calm

and opportunity with the
people in your organization.

Also, you have to think
through how you organize.
Are you gonna have a center of excellence

or are you gonna have a
more flatter, agile model
that cuts across your business?
And then we also encourage companies
to do a 90 day challenge
where you ask every area of your business

to think through what
their top use cases are.

And then also it's
important to just get moving
and learn as you go.

So really excited to see what
you do with this technology
and how you use it to shape your business.
And at AWS, we're really looking forward
to being part of the journey with you.
(upbeat music)
